item.title: Introduction
item.description: I have a wife with 2 kids. On a given night of the work week I’m usually practicing on the drum kit, playing board games (currently on Frosthaven, playing videos games online, maintaining a Cyberpunk Red system for FoundryVTT, or painting miniatures. Prior to raising kids I also played a lot of Ultimate (frisbee) and paintball. I wrote a separate long-winded post about my professional career. I do not have a social media presence so if you want to get in contact, you can try a git forge (see the icons in the left side bar), or finding me on Discord.

item.title: Career
item.description: All opinions here are my own, not my employer or any other organization cited here. Overview I started with a 2 year stint at HP as a software developer, got laid off, and have worked at Red Hat, Inc. ever since. IBM acquired us a few years ago and continues to behave like an ally too, which is encouraging. It’s been almost 16 years now. My job experience has made me a Swiss-army knife in this industry and I continue to drive Red Hat’s use of software technology, manufacturing process, and portfolio management every day.

item.title: Minis
item.description: For fun, I paint miniature models that I think look cool. I don’t play war games like Warhammer or anything like that, just paint. I do play a lot of board games and often paint minis in those, or the minis in friends’ board games. Random minis to paint make for good birthday presents or work rewards too. I’m not too concerned with having a presentable “set”. A long time ago I dipped my toe into photography and had bought a macro lens for my camera, which is a Canon Rebel T5i.

item.title: Games
item.description: I do have a video gaming habit. I’m currently working on a single player run of Cyberpunk 2077. I’ll put more history here some time soon. While I do have other consoles, most of the time I’m on PC, and you can see my steam profile for what I’ve been playing lately. A little project I have going is making a decal for my car for each game I have spent more than 100 hours in.
